column4: ok, somebody help me out here. i'm new to this crap. folks were helping me a few minutes ago, now i get no response. did I offend some protocol i don't know about? have i stumped all of you geniuses? is my ignorance that offensive?
you have partion updates ... things are probably in a mess
you need to get more space
did you fill up a partition or the entire disk?
start a terminal ... or press Alt+Ctrl+F1 to switch to text mode ... do "df" and see
the lines with /dev/sda or /dev/hda are the ones to pay attention to ... sometimes also /dev/sdb or /dev/hdb
how big is sda1, sda2, sda3, sda4, etc?
can you give me the size of it?
the number you gave looks like a 4G device with some shaved off maybe for swap space ... did you install onto the SD card?
it sounds like you installed more than I did, or have other data taking up space (like downloaded music)
no registry per se ... various config files and databases
yes ... they were being updated and could not complete when disk is full
you can always reinstall ... that might help ... then this time don't add any new packages but check the space usage ... then update only and check usage again
backup your data to the SD card or a USB memory stick
you probably need to re-install from scratch ... that should work, even if you don't really need to ... but manually fixing as it is now probably is "in over your head"
you might need to install less stuff
I did an install then an upgrade, without adding other packages, and the size I got was much less than the size of your space
